post.summary: Creates a single datapoint where the assets are fetched from the specified urls.
post.description:
Passing in multiple urls will create a single datapoint with a MultiAsset.
Each url will be fetched and stored as a sub-asset of the MultiAsset.
<para />
If any of the urls are not accessible, the request will fail.

post.summary: Unlocks a newly cloned order.
post.description:
When an order is cloned only the necessary information is copied.
In order to make changes to the order, it must be unlocked first.
Unlocking the order will clone the entire dataset and its datapoints.

parameters.description: The id of the order to unlock

post.summary: Submits an order for approval.
post.description:
Once an order is created its order id and dataset id is returned.
The dataset id can be used to fill the dataset with data points.
Once submitted, the order will be locked and no further changes can be made.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to submit

post.summary: Submits an order for approval.
post.description:

The dataset id can be used to fill the dataset with data points.
Once submitted, the order will be locked and no further changes can be made.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to submit

post.summary: Approves an order that has been submitted for manual approval.
post.description:
An order is submitted for manual approval when the automatic approval process could not automatically
determine if the order is safe to process.
Once an order is approved, the pipeline will start processing the order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to approve

get.summary: Gets the clients for the current customer.
get.description:
A client allows a customer to authenticate with the APIs without using their own credentials.
This is useful for creating service accounts or other automated processes,
as when using the Rapidata Python SDK.

A client allows a customer to authenticate with the APIs without using their own credentials.

parameters.description: Whether the oldest or most recent responses should be returned.

CreateDatapointFromFilesModel.description:
The form request for creating a datapoint from files.
Needs to be encoded as a json string in the form request.

sortIndex.description: The index will be used to keep the datapoints in order. Useful if upload is parallelized

metadata.description:
Additional metadata to attach to the datapoint.
Most commonly used to add a prompt to the datapoint using the Rapidata.Shared.Assets.Abstraction.Models.Metadata.Input.PromptMetadataInput.

CreateDatapointFromTextSourcesModel.description: The body request for uploading text sources to a dataset.

urls.description:
The urls to fetch the assets from.
The urls must be publicly accessible.
A HEAD request will be made to each url to check if it is accessible.

metadata.description:

CompareWorkflowModel.title: CompareWorkflow

criteria.description: The criteria that the datapoints should be compared based on. No default value.

pairMakerConfig.description: The PairMaker config determines the pair making algorithm for compare workflows

metadata.description: The metadata is attached to every single rapid and can be used for something like the prompt.

CompareWorkflowModel.description:
If the SimpleWorkflow is chosen, each datapoint uploaded will correspond to a single task to be solved.
This is the most commonly chosen workflow.

CreateComplexOrderModel.description: The model for creating a new order with a custom pipeline.

CreateDatasetArtifactModel.title: CreateDatasetArtifactModel
CreateDatasetArtifactModel.description: Model for creating a dataset artifact

CreateOrderModel.title: CreateOrderModel

orderName.description: The name is used as an identifier for an order and can be freely chosen.

workflow.description: The workflow helps to determine the tasks that need to be completed by the users.

referee.description: The referee is used to determine how many votes will be collected.

aggregator.description: The aggregator is used to determine how the data will be aggregated. The default behavior is enough for most cases

featureFlags.description: The feature flags are used to enable or disable certain features.

priority.description: The priority is used to prioritize over other orders.

isSticky.description: Indicates if the underlying campaign should be sticky.

userScoreDimensions.description: The user score dimensions are used to determine the score of the responses from the user.

demographicKeys.description: The demographic keys are used to determine which demographics to store on the resposnes from the user.

userFilters.description: The user filters are used to restrict the order to only collect votes from a specific demographic.

validationSetId.description:
The validation set id can be changed to point to a specific validation set. if not provided a sane default will be
used.

selections.description: The selections are used to determine which tasks are shown to a user.

CreateOrderModel.description: This model is used to create a simple order

CreateSimplePipelineModel.title: CreateSimplePipelineModel

items.description: Base model for a pipeline step

namePrefix.description: The prefix for the pipeline name

CreateSimplePipelineModel.description: Model for creating a simple pipeline

dataType.description: The type of the data that was attempted to be ordered

labelType.description: The type of the labels that were attempted to be ordered

CreateUnsupportedOrderModel.description: The model for creating an order with an unsupported label type or data type.

DatasetEvaluationStepModel.title: DatasetEvaluationStepModel

aggregationResultFileArtifactId.description: The identifier of the resulting aggregation file

evaluationResultFileArtifactId.description: The identifier of the resulting evaluation file

receiver.description: The email address of the receiver to be notified once the step is completed

DatasetEvaluationStepModel.description: Model for the dataset evaluation step

EarlyStoppingRefereeModel.title: EarlyStoppingReferee

maxVotes.description: The upper limit of votes that will be collected for each task.

threshold.description: The threshold that needs to be reached to stop collecting votes.

EarlyStoppingRefereeModel.description:
The Early Stopping Referee can currently only be used for classification tasks and will stop once a certain
threshold is reached or the maximum number of votes is collected.

startingElo.description: The starting ELO score for each datapoint.

kFactor.description:
The K-factor to use in the ELO calculation.
Determines the maximum possible change in a player's Elo rating after a single match.
Higher K-Factor values result in larger rating changes.

scalingFactor.description:
Scaling factor to use in the ELO calculation.
Adjusts the sensitivity of the Elo rating system to differences in player ratings.
It affects how much the rating changes based on the expected outcome versus the actual outcome.

EloConfigModel.description: These parameters affect how the ELO algorithms behaves

EvaluationWorkflowModel.title: EvaluationWorkflow

validationSetId.description: The Validation Set id is used to as a source for the tasks that will be sent to the user.

shouldAcceptIncorrect.description:
Indicates if the user should get feedback on their answers if they answer wrong. If set to true the user will not
notice that he was tested.

EvaluationWorkflowModel.description:
If the EvaluationWorkflow is chosen a validation set will be used as a source for all tasks.
It functions similarly to the SimpleWorkflow as there is a 1:1 mapping between validation rapids and tasks.

key.description: The key is used to identify the feature flag.

value.description: The value is used to determine if the feature flag is enabled or disabled or can be a configuration option.

FeatureFlagModel.description: A feature flag is used to enable or disable certain features.

email.description: The email of the user submitting the feedback

token.description: The recaptcha token of the user submitting the feedback

NaiveRefereeModel.title: NaiveReferee

totalVotes.description: The number of votes that need to be collected as a minimum.

NaiveRefereeModel.description: The NaiveReferee is used to collect a fixed number of votes.

OnlinePairMakerConfigModel.title: OnlinePairMaker

randomMatchesRatio.description: The ratio of random matches for the algorithm to burn-in.

totalComparisonBudget.description: Total number of comparisons to carry out.

OnlinePairMakerConfigModel.description:
The OnlinePairMaker creates random pairs in the beginning and then continues to create pairs
that are close in ranking.

SendCompletionMailStepModel.title: SendCompletionMailStepModel

receiver.description: The email address of the receiver

resultsFileArtifactIdentifier.description: The identifier of the results file

SendCompletionMailStepModel.description: Model for the send completion mail step

SimpleWorkflowModel.title: SimpleWorkflow

blueprint.description:
The blueprint is used to create the tasks that will be shown to the users. They contain the common information
across all tasks. For example, the tasks question.

SimpleWorkflowModel.description:
If the SimpleWorkflow is chosen, each datapoint uploaded will correspond to a single task to be solved.
This is the most commonly chosen workflow.

displayName.description: An optional display name for the client.

customerId.description: An optional customer ID to create the client for.

email.description: The email of the user to subscribe or unsubscribe.

token.description: The recaptcha token to verify the user is not a bot.

NewsletterModel.description: Model for subscribing and unsubscribing to the newsletter.

token.description: A recaptcha token to verify the user is not a bot.

RegisterTemporaryCustomerModel.description: The model for signing up a new temporary user.

access_token.description: The access token to authenticate the user.

expires_in.description: The time in seconds until the access token expires.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token to refresh the access token.

id_token.description: The id token to identify the user.

token_type.description: The type of token. Usually, this is "Bearer".

scope.description: The scope of access the token has.

RegisterTemporaryCustomerResult.description: The access parameters of the newly registered temporary customer.

payload.description: The payload to use for the rapid.

metadata.description: Some metadata to attach to the rapid.

truth.description: The ground truth for the rapid.

explanation.description: An explanation for the users if they answer the rapid incorrectly.

payload.description: The payload to use for the rapid.

metadata.description: Some metadata to attach to the rapid.

truth.description: The ground truth for the rapid.

texts.description: The texts to use for the rapid.

explanation.description: An explanation for the users if they answer the rapid incorrectly.

name.description: The name of the validation set.

cocoSetId.description: The ID of the CoCo set to use for validation.

categories.description: A subset of the categories from the CoCo set to use in the rapids.

key.description: The identifier of the demographic classification.

rapidId.description: The ID of the Rapid that was skipped.

sessionIndex.description: The index of the session when the Rapid was skipped.

RapidSkippedModel.description: The model for a Rapid skipped.

rapidId.description: The rapid an issue was encountered with.

message.description: An optional message typed by the user.

dump.description: A dump, that the frontend defines and can read again.

AddCampaignModel.title: AddCampaignModel

artifactId.description: The id of the campaign artifact. If not provided a random value will be used.

userFilters.description: The user filters to apply to the campaign.

validationSetId.description: A validation set that should be used.

selections.description: The selections that the campaign should have.

featureFlags.description: The feature flags that should be applied to the campaign.

isSticky.description: Indicates if the campaign is sticky.

isPreviewEnabled.description:
A flag to indicate whether the campaign should be put into preview mode after creation.
This way the campaign will not start automatically and the user will have to manually start it.

AddCampaignModel.description: The model for adding a campaign to an existing pipeline.

CompareWorkflowConfigModel.title: CompareWorkflowConfig

criteria.description: The criteria to add to each compare rapid.

pairMakerConfig.description: The PairMaker Algorithm's config that is used for making matchups

targetCountryCodes.description: A list of country codes that this workflow is targeting.

metadata.description: The metadata is attached to every single rapid and can be used for something like the prompt.

CompareWorkflowConfigModel.description:
The configuration for creating a compare workflow.
A compare workflow is a workflow that continuously matches datapoints against each other and updates their
respective ELO scores. The ELO scores are used to determine the relative strength of the datapoints,
and datapoints are matched against other datapoints with similar ELO scores.
The end goal is a ranking of the datapoints based on their relative strength.

sendEmail.description: Whether to email the user when the download is ready.

PreliminaryDownloadModel.description: The model for creating a preliminary download.

SimpleWorkflowConfigModel.title: SimpleWorkflowConfig

blueprint.description:
The blueprint to use when creating rapids for this workflow.
The blueprint determines what kind of rapids will be created and what data they will contain.

targetCountryCodes.description: A list of country codes that this workflow is targeting.

SimpleWorkflowConfigModel.description:
The configuration for a simple workflow.
A simple workflow creates a rapid for each datapoint in its dataset.
It is considered complete when all rapids have been completed.

priority.description:
A value above 0 indicating how much the campaign should be prioritized.
The higher the value the more weight it will be given during campaign selection.

featureFlags.description: The feature flags to assign this campaign.

UpdateCampaignModel.description: The model containing the new configuration for a campaign.

bearer.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. Example: "Authorization: Bearer {token}"
bearer.name: Authorization

oauth2.description: OAuth2 authorization code flow, supporting OpenID Connect.
